website_summaries.verdict: A good price for a bio-metric safe that holds a couple of long-guns.
pros: Designed to hold up to 4 rifles
Can be wall mounted or set on the floor
Can store up to 120 different fingerprints
cons: This is not a fireproof or waterproof safe
It is not big, but works well for a couple of guns

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working immediately. Much smaller than stated.
customer_reviews.text: So after reading reviews I knew it would be 50/50. When it showed up, I realized the internal capacity was much smaller than I pictured. It fits one small rifle with no optic at all, and there’s no way at all you could fit another. The biometric reader stopped working about a month after I purchased it. After changing batteries, resetting fingerprints over and over I gave up. Oh they had the nerve to include a foam block for to accommodate four rifles. You couldn’t fit four rifles in there dismantled and stacked like Tetris.. Avoid
customer_reviews.author: Guest

customer_reviews.title: Good for paintball and maybe paper.
customer_reviews.text: The only weapon aside from a conceal able weapon that fits in here is maybe going to be a youth 22. My ar-15 hand grip touches both sides. The 870 wingmaster is too long and the 22s don't even fit inside with a scope on them.... Use it for maybe ammo or to shoot at
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: The fingerprint scan is a good idea, but not when it only works once ...
customer_reviews.text: The fingerprint scan is a good idea, but not when it only works once every 15-30 times. I've tried resetting it 10 times to no avail. Now I just decide if I want to try for 5-10 minutes to open it w my fingerprint or get the hidden override key. (And too big and heavy to return, not to mention the two hours to install it since the door is heavier than the body, so if not bolted down, it will fall over.)
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very Dangerous & Deadly Design, Too Small for AR15
customer_reviews.text: This is the most stupid rifle safe ever! Do not buy it if you have mutiple AR15 rifles, it is too small! It is very dangerous too because the tendency to fall forward toward you when you open the door. It can hurt and probably kill small children.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: I love this safe
customer_reviews.text: Fast, quiet (once quiet mode is enabled) not too big, not too small. I have three rifles in it now and some ammo on the shelf. It bolts to a beam with mounting holes on the inside. I bought some magnetic, motion activated lights. Really an ideal solution. Also, I'm tickled by the idea of getting a gun safe with free shipping. One thing I'd add if I were them, there seems to be room for another shelf. I was going to add one, but never got around to it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Shockman

customer_reviews.title: good safe, sorta!
customer_reviews.text: Good safe! Kinda?!?!? Everything arrived as expected and was easy to configure and secure. As I was loading my four rifles into the safe (which didn’t fit, two with Optics at most, two with no optics and one pistol ar with optics can fit). Noticed damage along the top and paint chipped off. All attempts to contact via webpage failed or website would fail to load or error. Unable to contact support about damage during shipping so far or heard back from first request.
customer_reviews.author: Littlehorns

customer_reviews.title: Barska Gun Safety Cabinet
customer_reviews.text: 1st this is a home/office safety cabinet, small space i got a mossberg 590 shockwave and a AR15 Pistol 10.5" barrel 27" total lenght, on top shelve a Rugger LPC2 with 4 -50rds 9mm boxes , on shelve below i got 4-30rds AR15 magazines...not bad for what i looking for, Cons. Aint fix 4 rifles unless you remove optics and magazines, may be fix all4 winchester style rifle without optics , but for sure you can stack 3 sides way, very good material can be break yes , easy to break dont think so, for the price is really good im from Puerto Rico this box cost around $450..
customer_reviews.author: Miguel C.

customer_reviews.title: Biometric Reader is Junk
customer_reviews.text: Overall this Item is terrible. Not a safe but a cabinet. If the selling point is the biometric lock it’s a big miss. Tried all the tricks. Saved same finger 10 times but hit and miss when trying to unlock the cabinet. Not quick access by any stretch. I’m not sending it back because of the hassle. I will just use the key to operate the lock. Look for another safe.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Good small safe for rifle and handgun
customer_reviews.text: I just finished installing my safe. Then moved on to the programming of the fingerprint. I must admit it had me a little baffled until I watched a video from the manufacturer. There is a little red switch near the inside hinge of the door which must be pressed before programming the print. Things went extremely well after that. I think most problems listed about the biometric feature may be due to user error, believing that the button on the front of the lock is used for programming. But obviously that would not make sense. The red button may be covered with a cap that needs to be removed to press it. Over and out.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Won't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more disappointed. I did my research, I knew the good and bad about this safe and thought I knew what I was getting into. The safe arrived today. I can't open it; it came with the wrong emergency keys. In order to open it the first time you must use the emergency keys to do so; it would help if the correct ones were shipped with the safe.
customer_reviews.author: PHD

customer_reviews.title: Great Safe
customer_reviews.text: Safe is solid, fingerprint access works great and has a backup battery module you plug into the front of the door by the latch in case you’re internal batteries are dead. A bit shallow, however for some full-sized pistols to store in grip-facing orientation - make sure you measure for any pistol hangers you intend on using with this safe. Lastly, the little nitpicky details like the rifle holder and the space for, but lack of, a second shelf inside the unit were fixable and not a problem of note when compared to price vs. effort to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Works just as explained
customer_reviews.text: This safe came in perfect condition, the finish is a nice glossy textured black paint. The case is very strong, much stronger than a file cabinet. The parts are welded very nicely. It's very easy to use not much figuring out. Press the button, register your fingers then it's good to go. I bolted mine to the wall studs and to the cement. I had to purchase cement bolts. My AR with a scope and a rifle with a scope fit side by side, there is enough room for handguns on the top but not another rifle. I would def recommend this safe for gun owners with one or two rifles.
customer_reviews.author: wa

customer_reviews.title: TINY !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It will only hold my AR and that is only after I strip the rails. basically 1 gun if you have a scope !!!. My shotgun won't fit its to tall, with standard barrel... It really sucks to spend 3 bills for a 1 gun safe.... NOT HAPPY !!! I have a Barska pistol safe and love it... This is tiny !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad for What It Is Good For
customer_reviews.text: One thing about this safe is that it is really not practical for AR style rifles. The size of the rifle from top to bottom with pistol grip and installed magazine (small size) and the rifles tend to not allow the door to close. It's a perfectly workable safe if you are planning on storing 4 standard straight style rifles. In fact, it's great for that. Fingerprint reader works well, and opens after a few seconds. Most users I think will have rather purchased a safe that is at least 2 inches deeper and 2 inches wider.
customer_reviews.author: Reader0111

customer_reviews.title: If your life depends on this junk biometric fingerprint reader, you are going to die.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing four years ago. I can barely fit two rifles and a pistol in it, but that’s not the main problem. The main problem is that the biometric fingerprint reader can work fine some days, and then on other days , like tonight, I had to try it - this is not an exaggeration - fourteen times before it went green and opened. That ever happen trying to turn on your iPhone? I hope you don’t need whatever is inside this safe in a hurry. It’s a frustrating piece of equipment, and when I finally do replace it, I’m going to throw it off of a bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Agim Zabeli

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it should
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I bought a shotgun and wanted it secure from the kids and easy to access for me. Is it going to keep a safe cracker out of it? Probaby not, but it is durable, heavy and will prevent anyone from easily getting into it. I have it anchored to the wall with the screws and anchors included. I was easily able to save about 7 or 8 versions of my fingerprint at various angles and have never had an issue getting into it. I keep shells and other accessories on the shelf and could fit two more shotguns or rifles pretty easily. I highly recommend this safe.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Junk
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of.... junk! I own one Barska safe that i've never had a problem with but I will certainly never buy anything of theirs again. The package should have been a warning when it said Made in China, To US! Piece of junk arrived and wouldn't open with the emergency key or the key pad. When I called Barka the guy said yep sounds like you got a defective lock, just send it back and we refund or send a new one. Of course that's after I lugged this heavy piece of junk in the house and up the stairs. I don't want another that might be broke too!
customer_reviews.author: Big J

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this safe if you want to store a rifle with optics or a pistol grip
customer_reviews.text: This safe is advertised as holding up to 4 rifles. Well, if your rifles have optics and/or pistol grips, as mine do, then forget it. The door won't close. You have to turn the rifle sideways and then the safe can only accommodate one rifle. I just looked at the video posted on the Amazon page. I now see how cleverly they avoid showing rifles being stored and removed. If you look carefully you will notice that not one of these is an AR or other weapon with optics or a pistol grip. Shame on me for not doing more research on this product before buying it. Now I have a large metal box that is useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: RBork

customer_reviews.title: Safe lasted three months and then the issues started.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the product at the end of May and installed it in my wall in the middle of June. Now the safe has trouble opening when the biometric reader works. It's almost like the lock is stuck closed. The 2nd issue when I press the button to turn on the biometric reader I get a strange siren sound and the reader doesn't work at all. The customer service phone number doesn't work and the company hasn't answered my email in close to two weeks. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint ID is unreliable and doesn't work well, very small inside.
customer_reviews.text: If this wasn't already bolted to a wall, I'd be returning it. Only about 30% of the time will the fingerprint ID work for me, it doesn't work at all for my partner's prints. The initial setup seemed to work, and I was able to get in and out of the safe (hence bolting it onto the wall). Programmed multiple finger prints, and each one will work, but only very occasionally. Although the safe itself is pretty large, the interior is tiny, more than 1 rifle with a scope is unlikely to fit. I would not recommend this safe, especially if you want fast access to the contents.
customer_reviews.author: pdxbrit

customer_reviews.title: Small in size, but quality control is awful.
customer_reviews.text: I like the small size. However, quality control is awful. Two screws missing on inside of door, three screws not tight at all and door does not seal off, but is very loose. Foam not installed, top logo not level, dent in bottom left side, two batteries were crushed when there was no visible damage to shipping container, so none of this is UPS’s fault.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Napalo

customer_reviews.title: Too Small for AR-10 wth Scope
customer_reviews.text: I have an S&W M&P AR-10 outfitted with a UUQ C4-12X50 Rifle Scope Dual Illuminated Reticle W/Green(RED) Laser Sight and 4 Tactical Holographic Dot Reflex Sight (also purchased from Amazon). My AR-10 rifle will not fit in this safe regardless of orientation. It's not a bad safe, and I am storing my 12 gauge as well as a .38 and .45 on the door using specially designed safe holsters. However, if you have an AR-10 or 15 with accessories such as a scope, look for a bigger safe.
customer_reviews.author: Valkerie Silk

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship and quality from Barska
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the workmanship and quality of the material. Very cheap door opener poorly assembled. Door doesn't have a tight seal. Horrible packaging direct from Barska. Item arrived dented, cracked, scratched and chipped. Not impressed with the Barska products at. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Just a touch too small
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have measured, but I have a hunting shotgun, and a rifle with scope. Neither of those fit very well. The shot gun is too tall because of the shelf. Also with the scope attached to the rifle, the door almost doesn’t want to close. I put a handgun on the top shelf which works. Wish it had lights inside. The fingerprint entry was easy to program, and seems to read my print every time
customer_reviews.author: Chitty

customer_reviews.title: This is a 3 rifle safe, not a 5 rile safe.
customer_reviews.text: This is a THREE rifle safe, not a 5 rifle safe. I also have to put one of the three rifles in upside down to make it fit. I had trouble getting the scanner to read my finger/thumb prints. I found it very helpful to scan each of my fingers and thumbs like 10 times each (you have over 100 scans avalable). After that, it grants me access on the 1st try almost every time. I turned off the sound so an intruder cannot hear me trying to open the gun safe. That is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but not very secure
customer_reviews.text: This has been a really good case and I've not had any issues with the biometric reader. I think the key is to read the same finger multiple times and angles. The case itself isn't going to hold up to a fire or hard bashes but I needed something inexpensive that would keep the little kids out and give easy/fast access to the adults. An adult could easily pry this open with a crow bar. Just keep that in mind before purchasing. All that being said, I read the reviews and knew what I was getting. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T

customer_reviews.title: Great safe for tiny guns
customer_reviews.text: This safe is great... seems to be made well. Fingerprint scanner works flawlessly so far. It is also so incredibly small that I can barely fit my hand inside to pull anything out. My 1911 barely fits on the top shelf, and I had to almost completely disassemble my AR to fit it inside. NOTHING else would fit in there with those two things inside; not even a mag. I'll probably re-gift this to my daughter for her .22 and her shotgun and buy something significantly larger for myself. TL:DR; this is a safe for a Barbie house.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Solid safe! See pictures for necessary supplies.
customer_reviews.text: Solid safe. I mounted it to the wall, suspended off the floor and it’s not budging. Firearms are secured away from kids, and attempted robberies will require considerable effort to remove before police arrive from home alarm being activated. I bought a stud finder so I could drill 3 of the screws into the stud and stronger anchors for the three holes not drilled into a stud. I needed a 1/2 ratchet to tighten the screws provided securely. See pictures for supplies I used.
customer_reviews.author: ambris

customer_reviews.title: Great product for small amount of arms.
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with my purchase. Its definitely small. I can only fit 2 rifle placed sideways, and 3 hand guns in there. But it works for me. I can safely store it inside my closet. The fingerprint scanner takes about 3 seconds to open for first registered fingerprint and then it takes an additional 1 second per other registered fingerprints. So if you have 5 fingerprints registered, the 5th fingerprint will take about 5 seconds to unlock the safe.
customer_reviews.author: Motiger

customer_reviews.title: A good, inexpensive choice.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive security. This will not likely prevent access by a determined thief with time, but it will keep out unwanted hands long enough for you deal with the situation appropriately. Unit looks nice and mounts easily. Fingerprint reader works well, but is a little inconsistent, especially with low batteries. Low batteries are your enemy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Daneel

customer_reviews.title: decent lock up for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with it so far. It seems sturdy and I haven't had any trouble with the biometric lock. It's not fireproof and is unlikely to keep a determined burglar from getting in but for the money, it's worth it. The finish is pretty primitive but everything moves (opens/closes, locks/unlocks) as it is supposed to and since it's in the closet, who cares. I bolted mine to the concrete and screwed the back into wall studs but I would recommend buying your own concrete anchors as the ones they include are pretty cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: diydan

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be bigger. Biometrics could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The lock is a little more finicky than I would like. It's a lot better if you register the same finger a few times though. Aside from the lock I maybe wouldn't purchase this for anything bigger than a couple hunting rifles. Anything with a handle is a PITA to get in and out and certainly not for anything like an AR with a mag and scope... Forget that. Top compartment has just enough room for my 45 if you fanangle it a bit. Bottom line... This thing needs to be bigger. Its ok for quick access but you can't comfortably fit anything you would need quick access to in it.
customer_reviews.author: Heiliger

customer_reviews.title: Defective. No key to open it.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged without accessories. Without accessories the safe cannot open. It is useless in a functional way if it cannot open. I received a replacement. The second one had accessories but the biometric does not work. It opens with a key but not with biometrics.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Put your fingerprint in multiple times
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a problem with this safe or its locking mechanism. Sometimes I would like access to be a little faster (it still only take a half second or less) w/ a pop open feature (rather than handle to turn after the green light access indicator) but that would be icing on the cake. Putting your fingerprint in multiple times reduces the chance that the safe wont recognize you (I've only had that happen one time and that was when my hand was very dirty. Washed my hands and no problem).
customer_reviews.author: mommy of 4

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level safe to keep in the bedroom. I keep this next to my bed for my shotgun and handguns. Fingerprint opens fast. About a second. Rarely has a bad reading. Not the most robust safe obviously so I recommend screwing it into your studs. Good for about one shotgun or rifle with no optics and a handgun.
customer_reviews.author: TheEvan

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting quality
customer_reviews.text: Long lasting quality. I purchased this safe several years ago and installed it in my bedroom. Original intention was to keep a pistol for myself and a shotgun for my wife close by. The idea is that you only need your fingerprint in the dark or in an emergency. While I still keep a pistol in the safe mostly it holds the kids video game consoles when their playtime is up. Point of the story; this safe gets opened two times a day every single day without ever malfunctioning. Twice a day, every week, every month, going on 4 years now. If I could change anything I would've bought a larger version.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Shotgun Safe
customer_reviews.text: I went to Lowe's and got a $20 investment some cheap carpet lining for the inside of the safe with some spray adhesive. The thief works perfect. I saw the exact same one at the gun store where I purchased my two weapons and it was $258.00. It will easily store up to for shotguns. I don't own any rifles so I don't know whether they will fit in there with the scope or not. I can tell you that it easily fits my shotguns and one small handgun at the top. I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: CAS

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I went to open my safe and after pressing the button to scan my finger, the green light started to flash and make a beeping noise non stop. The biometric scanner does not scan and the beeping and flashing will not stop. This is not because I need new batteries. The beeping is different if and when you need to change out your batteries. Plus, it has now been two days that this beeping has gone on as I’m waiting for my replacement keys. Thankfully, I was not in immediate need of my firearms, but if I did, I’d be in a bad situation. This safe is unreliable and not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Yerda

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend as a true safe but does the job
customer_reviews.text: This will not keep your guns safe in a fire and unless you bolt it to the wall someone can just walk off with it because it is very light. It will keep your young kids out of it and I haven’t had any problems with keypad. A determined teenager could probably get in with tools. You get what you pay for in a safe. Personally If your able to afford to spend $400 more on a real safe then go that route but if your on a budget it will do the job. I can fit AR and shotgun in it with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: nice little safe
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built. it's worth some effort to put some decent padding on the floor of it and the shelf. I used some felt on the shelf so the pistol wouldn't be metal on metal. as said before, a rifle with a scope has to be turned to fit. but with some adjustment you can get it and a shotgun in there. No fireproofing on it, but makes a decent protection in the home from small fingers. Make sure you anchor it, its not very heavy at all, even loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Bootsma

customer_reviews.title: Just received, good value for the dollar but flawed product reg process
customer_reviews.text: Just received and set up my safe (AX11652), looks solid and built well, other than the plastic feel/wiring for the internal battery pack for fingerprint reader). Bottom line, seems like a great value for the dollar and no reason to think it will fail fast over time...BUT, Barska has an annoying product reg page. It won't accept your contact detail unless you click 'yes' to them sending emails. Pretty lame, assuming I can opt out of marketing crap after they send me email.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this because of some bad reviews, but I'm glad I did! The safe is sturdy and set up was very easy. It took less than five minutes to get multiple finger prints saved. It's definitely on the small side, but if you're only planning on storing a rifle or two, this is perfect. Another great aspect is that it gives you the option to shut off the annoying beeping noises. Once you do that, it makes virtually no sound. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: noah

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: They say it fits 4 long guns. It will if they have no accessories like scopes on them. Scoped rifles with pistol grips will not fit. It can't be used free-standing, it must be bolted to a wall. The fingerprint reader works fine and the battery life is extremely good for the lock.
customer_reviews.author: GizmoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Small, but sturdy safe with quick access
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for and for a fantastic price. The fingerprint scanner seems to work every time and allows for quick access. It is very sturdy and, when properly mounted, isn't going anywhere. Perfect size for a small safe solution that's big enough for a few long guns as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Built okay
customer_reviews.text: To be upfront, I returned it due to a defect with the key, but after trying the biometric feature, I don't trust it's reader. If you want to use the key it'll probably be a good bet as it's built strong (seemingly), but I wouldn't trust the fingerprint reader to function in a hurry. Not a quick access safe. I have a vaultek biometric safe that never fails to open with prints, so its not my hands. This isn't a high end safe, nor is it marketed to be. If you are expecting Liberty quality, look elsewhere, but it sure ain't bad.
customer_reviews.author: bacon-ater

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small weapons
customer_reviews.text: This is a small case which is great if you ny have a couple items to store it fits perfectly by my stair case I like the finger print protection and it makes me feel better that the kids have no access and that we showed them that they could not get in.i like that you can program more than 1 finger
customer_reviews.author: Heather koehler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hide, cheap to buy and secure from young kids
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money safe, easy to install. I have a rifle and a pistol and wanted a safe place to keep them, away from my kids. This biometric system is slick and it is more secure than a key or a combination system, which my son would figure or find. This safe is slender enough that it is hidden in my closet and my kids don’t even know it even exists, just the way I like it.

customer_reviews.title: Good lighy-weight
customer_reviews.text: Overall great light safe for riffles, fingerprint reader has quick response and it comes with a battery backup. The product itself was good, it does scratch and paint peel easily. A corner arrived completely dinged and paint was scratched off. (Not worth the hassle to return or exchange since no one will really see it)
customer_reviews.author: Mammoth

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: The safe was damaged when I received it. It’s a big heavy safe and there didn’t seem to be any special shipping to ensure it would not be damaged. The fingerprint reader is iffy at best, often taking 2-3 tries in order to get it to open. We have 2 registered persons on it and it’s like it gets confused when switching between users. However, the price was good and I decided to keep it due to this being a post covid world now and not wanting to deal with the return. However, I would recommend looking elsewhere for a safe.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Wenbourne

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little bit small but love the biometrics
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price but had to take a shelf out for my long guns and is very very small if you have more than a couple of guns might want to look at getting something bigger especially if you have any scopes That being said I do love the fingerprint access opens up very quickly for both me and my wife
customer_reviews.author: S D

customer_reviews.title: But over all I enjoy the quality of the case to keep small children ...
customer_reviews.text: Small case, has room for my Savage .22LR, the small area at the top of the case is a bit too small for my 626 plus. But over all I enjoy the quality of the case to keep small children out. The finger print scanner works great. I would take off one star because the scanner was disconnected from the battery pack when I received the unit. A small trouble, but overall I am happy with the units. Notes: Material is thin, but I would not call it flimsy. Scanning is not too slow, it takes about an 'one allergator' to recognized my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Phalla

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, reliable and narrow
customer_reviews.text: It’s the second one I bought. I stacked them two high and mounted to the wall. I have a very narrow space where I have room for a rifle safe. It’s narrow and I have to squeeze in 3-4 in each but it’s doable. I would by the larger one if I had room. Finger print sensor works well and is reliable and lasts a long time without changing batteries.
customer_reviews.author: saint garius

customer_reviews.title: 2 of my children were able to open it!!! Please make sure that the safe is truely secure before relying on it for firearms!
customer_reviews.text: We are contacting the company and I am sure that they will exchange our faulty safe with a new one BUT After following the instructions and programming our fingerprints into the safe 2 of our children were able to open the safe with their fingerprints!!! And we were no longer able to open it with ours. Please make sure that the safe is truely secure before relying on it to hold your firearms!!
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Can’t even get started.
customer_reviews.text: We will see how Barska reacts as the key to open the safe doesn’t work. No way to use if you can’t first open the safe. Some damage in shipping as well. I could live with that but the safe is currently not functional. 6/2020 A year later and still no response fro Barska.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: good gun safe, but very small.
customer_reviews.text: Over all, it does its job by securing guns from kids. This safe must be secured to the wall/floor, else it will tip over, as soon as the door is opened (when empty). Also, the safe only fits 2 AR-15's. I don't think you can close the door with 3 rifles, the advertisement picture is deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Shipped quickly and arrived in good shape. Fingerprint setup was easy and quality is ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly and arrived in good shape. Fingerprint setup was easy and quality is the same as my other Barska, a nightstand safe for the HD handgun: good enough to keep kids out, but more a locker than a safe. I know that, so it's not a knock on the product. It is top heavy and unstable when you open the door, you will want to anchor to a wall or floor. All in all, good product that suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Webster

customer_reviews.title: Junk screws and anchors included
customer_reviews.text: The safe works pretty well. It's not a fireproof safe and like most in this class feels flimsy. But for the price it is what I expected and enough to keep curious kids out or an undetermined thief. My one gripe with it was that the screws and anchors that were included were complete junk. The screws themselves pulled right out of the anchors. The anchors are the typical plastic variety. Nothing a quick trip to the home center to get metal expanding anchors can't fix.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Thumbprint does not work poor quality do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been broken since the day I got it it does not read the fingerprint at all. It is very poor quality and I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: FRAIDNOT67

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, fingerprint reader fails constantly.
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t a high security safe at all. It’s very thin and can be easily opened with tools. Think of it as a gym locker that allows you to store a rifle or shotgun in a bedroom. From that perspective it does a good job. The real problem is the finger print reader. It sucks. It has false negatives all the time and always takes 4 or 5 tries to gain entry. It’s useless for an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: LTrain

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than you think but perfect for a closet.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this actually is pretty solid. It’s a locker not a safe but seems well made. The fingerprint reader is accurate and quick. It’s extremely small. My AR fits sideways with the magazine loaded but it’s really tight. Shotguns you could probably get more in. Perfect for want I needed it for. It does need to be mounted or anchored to the floor. If it’s not the door swinging open will tip it over on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Finger print reader could be better
customer_reviews.text: Finger printing takes multiple tries and inputs to work adequately. Works well enough when inserting digit fully but a little less effective with digit angled or not fully inserted. A little noisy to open. Over all a nice small safe for a couple long guns, about the size of a piece of standard stationary and easily fits behind a door. Attaches to the wall to deter theft. Workmanship was a little off with some scratches and could use better finishing but I overall I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lec

customer_reviews.title: You can get a real safe that actually holds guns at Costco for $70 more.
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than what I believed to be advertised. Would barely hold one hunting shotgun, let alone a rifle, unless it's the row of Chinese SKS carbines pictured. Could not hold a handgun in a case comfortably. This item is more of an ammo locker than anything else. Safe is too heavy in the front and will fall forward if door is open. The product itself is quality, but could be larger. I don't really have a right to complain though seeing as I should have measured the dimensions first. I just wanted a cheap locker to put my guns into to protect them better than just having them lying around.
customer_reviews.author: Tactic Cat

customer_reviews.title: Um something’s were missing and the safe was previously used
customer_reviews.text: The box the safe came it looked like a repackage. There were scratches and some of the paint chipped off on the corners. I wonder if someone returned and this safe was repacked. The keys that were provided were wrong. The key didn’t even match the key hole. There was no battery pack for the back up power.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Biometric feature is not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Biometric feature is highly unreliable. I've given one star simply because i cannot leave zero stars, however, this product does not deserve any stars. Tried all fingers and the fastest time to open the safe was 5 minutes and the longest over 45 minutes. (i only had the product for 2 weeks before i returned it) When you have intruder trying to enter your home, failure of biomeric reader is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Uni-Ball Gel Grip RED (12)

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint safety features awesome
customer_reviews.text: Safety is number one with owning guns. After a lot of research we chose this one for the fingerprint safety feature. You can have up to 5 fingerprints saved into it. It has a loud beeping noise if someone messes with it. But there is the option to turn that off. It is sturdy and hubby put carpet all on the inside and it looks sharp with it he also added a light. It comes bare on the inside but you can then tailor it the way you want. It is a very nice safe and effective on keeping kids and others out! I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good gun safe!
customer_reviews.author: Garcia74

customer_reviews.title: Nice long gun safe
customer_reviews.text: I've waited to post because the 1st safe arrived with a defective circuit board. A easy call to Barska CS and they sent a new one and picked up the broken one. This new one has worked fine with 3 different prints registered. It's a good theft deterrent to prevent a smash and grab, or to secure around those you wish to deny access. It would take a thief with tools minutes to remove it. It is very light. I have it secured in the provided bolt down holes to the floor and wall. It holds 5 long guns and a few magazines comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Great safe - sturdy, heavy, crowbar resistant, mountable, and it's biometric. How cool is that? Works flawlessly might I add... The problem with this model is that it is far too small for me, I have to put my pistol in on an angle and it's not comfortable. Will be returning it to get the larger version, although I'm hesitant to spend $600 on something that only has a 1 year warranty...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the safe is heavy given the dimensions and seems like it would be difficult to open with a crowbar
customer_reviews.text: So far no complaints besides the installation instructions being barebone. Had to buy 3 Lag bolts to hit the stud, did not come with them. Not sure why others are saying this is a locker, the safe is heavy given the dimensions and seems like it would be difficult to open with a crowbar. I do not like how the door rattles a bit doesnt sit tight when closed. Overall safe fits my needs, storing my 12 gauge a box of ammo, 22 rifle and have enough room to store some paperwork, not a whole lot more space than that.
customer_reviews.author: Zhunt

customer_reviews.title: Your guns probably wont fit
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. One of my shotguns doesnt fit under the shelf. The only way to use it is to remove the shelf. And I like the shelf. And my gun is not that tall. Not well described. Also the rubber piece that is supposed to hold the barrels is cheap and unattached. Disappointed in that the description was inadequate, too short field normal sized guns and a cheap rubber insert
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller safe, this fit the bill. Installation and programming was easy. The fingerprint reader works well for me. It helps to put your finger on the pad the same way each time, in my case I match the underside of my knuckle with the edge of the reader and it works the first time, every time.
customer_reviews.author: Final Gravity

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be perfect for what I needed. One AR rifle, one shotgun, one .22 bolt action. First off, the bottom right corner was struck by something and the paint was chipped off. Same with top left corner. Unfortunately I didn't notice until I destroyed the packaging. Second, the bottom of this safe is bowed so that it doesn't sit flat on the floor, it rocks. Third, I can only fit my .22 & shotgun inside as long as I turn them sideways. Because the door sticks into the cabinet you end up with less room than it appears. Save your money, don't bother. FWIW, the biometric feature does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L.

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse Safe
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing smaller safe with security features often reserved for larger units. Easily holds my rifle, a shotgun, and a handgun on the top shelf. Doesn’t have room for much more, such as ammo, however my only concerns are the guns themselves. Highly recommend for apartment owners or those with tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastion

customer_reviews.title: Errors, errors, errors
customer_reviews.text: So many errors. In case of an emergency I can’t count on it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ninet

customer_reviews.title: NOT for Tactical GUNs
customer_reviews.text: Works great, kinda small inside great for “non tactical firearms” my AR does not fit I have to turn it sideways but I knew it wouldn’t and it’s perfect for my tiny room, thump scanner works 9/10 tries. Shipped pretty solid all in one piece. It can be bolted floor back or sides. It’s a 10/10 if you need a narrow safe in a tight place.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Steen

customer_reviews.title: The fingerprint scanner  just does not work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: The finger print reader will not work properly!!!! One time it works and then an hour later it will not work. I use the instructions to reset the senor, re-enter finger print scans, it works fine but after a period of time it will not unlock. This a new unit I received today 5/8/2020. I'll repose the unit and purchase a larger and more reliable gun safe else where. I should return it but I do not want to waste any more time repacking it and getting it to a shipper. Cannot recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph A. Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Great! Easily Programmed
customer_reviews.text: We had no problem programming the biometric safe with all 10 fingers for my husband and I, and drilled it into the wall to keep the unit standing since the door is incredibly heavy. Nice and sturdy, no issues at all! Love the handy top shelf at the top also.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Guo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Holds 3 rifles/shotguns and a handgun or two on the shelf. Very lightweight, so needs to be anchored to the wall so someone can't walk off with it. Had mine about 4 years and haven't needed to change the battery yet on the biometric reader. Lock still works great. Only drawback is that the shelf space is small. Holds a handgun or two, but not suited for holding a bunch or ammo or any paperwork really.
customer_reviews.author: andersg

customer_reviews.title: The thin profile allowed for an easy install in-between the studs
customer_reviews.text: Although not near as "beefy" as the large high-dollar gun safes, it has served my purpose and was the right price. Ended up building this into the wall for a much cleaner look (and probably safer). The thin profile allowed for an easy install in-between the studs.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: it's super easy to program your fingerprint and works consistently
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband for Christmas and received it very quickly, it's super easy to program your fingerprint and works consistently. Very heavy and durable, holds our guns well and comes with everything you need to mount it. My only complaint is that it was a bit smaller than I was expecting but considering we only have 3 guns they all fit perfectly inside. If you're looking for something to store your arsenal in, this isn't it, but if you need something to store a few guns and some cash or other important documents, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lexie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Pistol fits fine on the top shelve
customer_reviews.text: Feels very flimsy, but becomes a little more stable when attached to the wall. Still quite a bit of rattle when opening and closing. Certainly won't protect your gun from any serious thieves, but will work well to make sure kids don't get unsupervised access. Fingerprint works well so far. I've scanned the same finger around 5 times to make sure it'll work reliably. It won't fit more than one rifle with a 30rd mag. 10rd mag barely allows it to close, but realistically, this safe is for 1, maybe 2 rifles. Pistol fits fine on the top shelve. Overall, I'm happy with what I got for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: "Good" for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's good for the price, but it has a few flaws. It serves the purpose of keeping firearms away from children. I would not depending on it keeping your firearms safe from theft. Pros: • Great price • Biometric feature is very convenient Cons: • The carpet lining provided for the interior could not be thinner or cheaper in quality • The foam piece for holding the barrels of the rifles does not adhere well with the two-sided-tape provided. I eventually resorted to hot glue, which worked well • Although I haven't tried - I don't think it would especially difficult to break into
customer_reviews.author: N.P.

customer_reviews.title: Too small for AR even with no accessories.
customer_reviews.text: It is well made and the fingerprint recognituon feature works well as advertised. However, my AR rifle doesn't fit. I have taken off the iron sights and magazine off and the grip still sticks out too far for the door to close. I bought this safe to store my 2 AR''s and I cannot even for one in there as pictured. I would have to put it flat against the back wall and stack my rifles sideways. I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Jiyeon

customer_reviews.title: Important feature is lacking reliability.
customer_reviews.text: The fingerprint scanner needs work. Needs to be faster and more reliable. There are times where I would have to scan my finger 2-3 times before it accepts the scan. Otherwise, it's solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mangoz

customer_reviews.title: Happy I got it during a Deal of the Day ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems solid and was simple to install and test. Happy I got it during a Deal of the Day for $209 instead of $260. Dimensions are accurate and it arrived without any dings or scratches. It lost 2 stars because of its rather ridiculous warranty clause, so hopefully nothing goes wrong with it because I would be responsible for $150 just for inspection & S&H, which is almost what I paid for it. It's a 1 year warranty. So it's worrisome that they don't have much faith in their product.
customer_reviews.author: BoardyGamer

customer_reviews.title: ... if you have some of the more popular rifles like AR-15. With an optical on it or foregrip ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't think they safe is very practical if you have some of the more popular rifles like AR-15. With an optical on it or foregrip because it wont fit I wish I would have spent a little more money and got something bigger because I don't think it's going to really fit my weapons in there the way I want them to fit it is more so going to be like a locker for my guns
customer_reviews.author: Quency Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Definitely emergency safe
customer_reviews.text: You can only fit 1 Ar-15 with a scope in the bottom part. I have my pistol on the top shelf. That is maxed out. The finger print register was hard to do because the directions were not correct. I ended up searching repeatedly on Google and finally found out how to do it. I can't remember how I stumbled upon it. After registering the finger prints with the safe it worked perfect. Super easy quick access.
customer_reviews.author: Braeden

customer_reviews.title: If someone was determined, it could be accessed. It’s definitely more of a cabinet than a safe.
customer_reviews.text: It’s more of cabinet than a safe, but I was entertaining the idea of two separate Shotlocks, one for an AR, one for a shotgun. This is more secure, I feel, keeps dust out, and holds more than one magazine or tube of ammo. I spent much less than two ShotLocks. So far the biometric has worked just fine for my wife, I have not set it up for myself yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good safe but smaller than expect
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with safe but here are thoughts: PROS: sturdy Biometric scanner works well Very easy to mount to floor and wall CONS: Much smaller than hoped...2 guns max.. 3 not happening Must be bolted to wall or floor... Tips when door open if not bolted Shelf is not easily removable... And not adjustable
customer_reviews.author: JPK17

customer_reviews.title: Buy for the biometric, not capacity.
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I only have 2 long guns to store in this safe. No way to comfortably fit more than 2 long guns especially with optics. An ar15 w/ 10rd mag and eotech fit diagonally. A rem 870 w/ shell holder on receiver and no optics fits next to the ar. The top shelf can hold a glock 23 and 1 extra mag. One of the screws holding the inside panel in place was missing. If I didn't have a bunch of amazon gift cards to put towards this purchase, I'd be even more disappointed. The only reason this is getting 3 stars is the biometric lock. It works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: It's not really a safe it's more like locker with a weighted door and lock with a ...
customer_reviews.text: The product came quickly. It's not really a safe it's more like locker with a weighted door and lock with a nbiometric opening. It seems pretty cheap but it will do the job for now. We will have to upgrade shortly. The external battery cover was broken when it was delivered. Amazon insured me that they would contact the company and they would send out another cover.
customer_reviews.author: Mauishopper

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: The product works well. The lock is generally accurate. It installs easily enough and I like the design of it. My only concern is that it will not store a modern rifle (without optics or a standard magazine) without turning it sideways. So the capacity of four is actually more like two plus a handgun.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Gerrish

customer_reviews.title: This safe is really shallow.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a safe I could put my rifles in , close to the bed and be able to get into quickly. Those things were all covered until I figured out my rifles will not fit in them due to the depth. An AR-15 with a red dot sight on top is about 10" and when you put the rifles in this safe the sight hits the back and the handle sticks out to far to close the door. So, 2 of my AR's would fit and my DP12 also wouldn't fit. This guy is only 7.63" inside. Very disappointing. I didn't even consider that it might not be deep enough.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: very good rifle locker, but not really a safe.
customer_reviews.text: This "safe" is really more of a very gun locker. That is what it was purchased for. It will deter children, snooping quests, and probably even a smash-and-grab burgler. The metal gauge is thick enough that you would need a strong pry bar to open door, but the door could be pried open soon enough as there are only 4 locking bars (one each side) on the door. The safe is also not rated for any fire resistance. Valuables and valuable firearms should be stored in an actual gun fire safe. Use this safe for quick access to home defense firearms. But if you want piece of mind for vacations and possible fires you may want a stronger safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really secure cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Will update if any changes in performance. As long as you view it as a theft and access deterrent and not as a true safe you should be satisfied. The gauge of metal used makes this more of a cabinet with an overkill lock. Make sure to mount to wall I recommend aiming for a stud to be really secure. Setting up the biometric lock worked well for me. The biometric access makes opening the safe really easy, but I did have to deactivate the sound of the lock, way too loud. I recommend getting a couple battery operated LED lights to place inside.
customer_reviews.author: Greko

customer_reviews.title: Not a quick access lock after all
customer_reviews.text: The safe box is nicely made and finished. The problem is with the biometric lock. It only works some time. I've talked with customer service - very nice fellow. That doesn't change the nature of the lock. It will recognize one of the many times I've stored a copy of my finger print and will open for me about 1/2 the time. That means that I need to use the key to open the safe the other 1/2 of the time. The customer service rep. said the lock is "very fussy." No kidding! A number key pad would be much better. The good news is that the key lock works well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great gun safe
customer_reviews.text: Great gun safe, fits both shotguns and two handguns. Also, it has room for at least one more rifle or shotgun. It's designed to be a slim frame safe and won't fit an arsenal. The fingerprint scanner works great and is as sensitive as my iPhone fingerprint scanner. Great price and a grear buy. My only recommendation is that your don't use the provided bolts for mounting to the wall studs, you may need to buy your own screws.
customer_reviews.author: Ariston

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It perfect for upstairs, but only can fit my AR because of all my attachments. I can pile up my handguns as well. I have a bigger safe downstairs for the rest of guns, but like I said this is perfect for upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Got what I paid for. It’s def not heavy duty. Will serve it’s purpose for now. If you’re looking for a heavy safe that can fit more than a few firearms this is not it. The safe is also not lined so it can scratch any items inside. The biometric function and other functions work great. No issues there. I’m just going to have to spend a ton more to get what I really want.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette S.

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: safe itself is sturdy and exactly what i needed however the fingerprint reader is absolutely unreliable.. I should have bought a better model. You get what you pay for.,
customer_reviews.author: Holger Baeuerle

customer_reviews.title: It is minimal needed by law. Stops the kids.
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty unstable (can’t stand without being screwed in). Also, the side walls are super thin ... good for stopping kids and meeting CA requirements. Not really “safe” for theft.
customer_reviews.author: Morteza

product_meta.title: Barska Quick Access Biometric Rifle Safe
feature_bullets: Secure Storage: Our DOJ approved safes comes with a 120 fingerprint biometric module that has an optional silent mode.
Rifle Storage: The safe can store 4 rifles without any accessory attachments and comes with a removable shelf.
Solid Construction: This safe is built with solid steel walls, tamper-resistant edges, and 3 built-in pry-resistant steel deadbolts.
Mounting: The safe comes with pre-drilled holes and mounting hardware, allowing the safe to be easily mounted.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
